image.altText: Police officers in uniform patrolling a street.

props.synopsis: A former employee of Tasmania's notorious Ashley Youth Detention Centre has been arrested over alleged serious sexual offences, including child sexual abuse, while he was working at the centre.

title.children: Fomer employee of notorious Tasmanian children's prison charged over alleged abuse

image.altText: The side of a large ship in port.

props.synopsis: Another $120 million cost blowout hits the embattled Spirit of Tasmania vessel replacement project, with berth infrastructure set to cost $493 million.

title.children: Spirit berth gets $120m blowout but earlier completion date, government says

image.altText: A singer sings on stage with an orchestra accompanying him

props.synopsis: When Palawa man Dewayne Everettsmith held his firstborn child, he wanted to soothe him by singing in the language of Tasmanian Aboriginal people. That desire has sparked an extraordinary musical journey with the Tasmanian Symphony Orchestra.

title.children: Dewayne wanted to sing in palawa kani to his newborn â€” that's now possible

image.altText: Wynyard Wildcatz 3

props.synopsis: Many of the team of cheerleading girls from a tiny town in Tasmania had never even been on a plane, let alone left their country, but a fundraising effort to see them sent to the US has paid off.

title.children: Community effort to send Tassie girls to Florida ends with gold

image.altText: Jeremy Rockliff with a football.

props.synopsis: The definition of a "red cent" and a qualification of the $375 million in taxpayer money for the planned Hobart stadium matter when determining if the premier has broken his word.

title.children: Did the premier break his 'not a red cent more' stadium funding promise?

props.synopsis: Stateline Tasmania's Guy Stayner speaks with Labor's Julie Collins about the party's dominant result at the federal election.

title.children: 'Terrific result': Labor's Julie Collins on the thumping victory in Tasmania

image.altText: The Australian flag and a crucifix

props.synopsis: Since the 1970s Tasmania has gone from being around 90 per cent Christian to less than 40 per cent. So why does parliament and some of our councils begin with the Lord's Prayer? Airlie Ward talks with reporter Sandy Powell.

title.children: TassieCast: Does the Lord's Prayer still belong in our parliament?

image.altText: A close-up of Andre's hands, tinged blue under a UV light, holding a neon yellow piece of coral.

props.synopsis: Sought-after pieces of coral are sold all around the world, including at rave-like trade shows known as "frag swaps". The insatiable demand for a "piece of the reef" has put coral harvesting in the spotlight.

title.children: Glowing profits, delicate reefs: Inside Australia's coral gold rush

image.altText: Two small boats with people in uniform in the foreground and a large ship with a crane on it in the background.

props.synopsis: Designed to probe the devastating downing of an army helicopter that killed four people, the Taipan inquiry became something so much more â€” exposing deep flaws within the Australian Defence Force and exploring the very core of its culture.

title.children: Taipan inquiry shows defence has some hard truths to face

image.altText: Protesters seen holding signs and chanting slogans in Taipei.

props.synopsis: The so-called Great Recall campaign in Taiwan is deepening domestic political divides and rocking the self-ruled island's democracy.

title.children: 'Hostile China will be very pleased': Taiwan politics in crisis

image.altText: Two boys with their faces blurred in karate uniforms

props.synopsis: The bodies of the boys, aged six and seven, were found inside a home at Coonabarabran on Monday.Â

title.children: Woman charged with murder of her two grandsons

image.altText: Emergency services at Westfield Bondi Junction after multiple people were killed

props.synopsis: A lost email concerning Joel Cauchi's declining mental health, an overlooked emergency assessment and a briefly-empty CCTV security room are all being considered "missed opportunities" in the Bondi Junction stabbing inquest.

title.children: The string of 'missed opportunities' before fatal Bondi Westfield stabbing

image.altText: A composite image of Pope Leo and US President Donald Trump

props.synopsis: The election of Pope Leo XIV brings the Catholic Church closer to the United States in a way it has never been before, but with that comes a unique challenge.

title.children: 'This is a warning to Trump': What MAGA thinks of Pope Leo's election

image.altText: Donald Trump

props.synopsis: If the newly re-elected Albanese government is serious about Australian culture and production, then Donald Trump could be inadvertently showing the way to ensuring it.

title.children: If Albanese is serious about Aussie culture, Trump could be key to protecting it

image.altText: Mitch McGovern lays on the turf after being bumped

props.synopsis: Carlton defender Mitch McGovern is sent to hospital to get scans on his chest after being floored by a brutal bump in the first quarter a courageous win over St Kilda.Â

title.children: Carlton records courageous win as McGovern is rushed to hospital after brutal hit

image.altText: A small circular spacecraft

props.synopsis: An out-of-control Soviet-era spacecraft will plummet back to Earth today, if the latest tracking predictions are correct. But there's still a lot experts don't know.

title.children: Where will the Soviet-era probe crash back to Earth today?

image.altText: Payne Haas of the Broncos (centre) and teammates react following their loss

props.synopsis: After a 22-14 loss to South Sydney marked the fourth loss in five games for Brisbane, NRL great Johnathan Thurston questions if the Broncos have improved since finishing 12th in 2024.Â

title.children: Thurston questions if Broncos are any better than dismal 2024 season

image.altText: Bowen Yang is hugged from behind by Han Gi-chan in a still from The Wedding Banquet.

props.synopsis: Before Brokeback Mountain, Ang Lee's The Wedding Banquet was one of the most groundbreaking films of the 90s, particularly for queer Asian-Americans. So how do you re-imagine such a classic, while keeping it relevant to a modern audience? We asked its director.

title.children: How do you keep a groundbreaking film relevant, three decades later?

image.altText: An old black and white photograph of a man named Arthur Leggett in a military uniform.

props.synopsis: West Australians will gather today to commemorate the state's last World War II prisoner of war, Arthur Leggett.

title.children: WA prepares to farewell Arthur Leggett, state's last WWII prisoner of war

image.altText: a young man with a hat hugging his white dog

props.synopsis: Anthony Rowse builds skip bins for a living. At night, he sleeps in a tent by a lake with his dog, Ghost, as one of a growing number of homeless regional Victorians.

title.children: Worker makes plea to housing inquiry before going home to his tent

image.altText: An aerial photo of a housing development beside the ocean

props.synopsis: Thousands of blocks are hitting the market in Queensland's Wide Bay as communities grapple with population growth and changing identities.

title.children: Sleepy coastal towns becoming 'next Sunshine Coast' as development booms

image.altText: A woman peers over the top of the book she is reading

props.synopsis: For millions of devoted readers, romantasy is more than spicy sex scenes and towering warriors with impressive wingspans. It's escapism in its purest form.

title.children: Romantasy might seem like pure smut but to its fans it's so much more

image.altText: Marta Kostyuk clenches her fist during a tennis match.

props.synopsis: After years of refusing to acknowledge Russian players after matches, Ukrainian Marta Kostyuk shakes the hand of Daria Kasatkina after her defection to Australia.

title.children: Ukrainian praises Kasatkina's courage in stepping away from Russia

image.altText: Three men wearing black suits stand in a row with red flags in front of them

props.synopsis: Russia marks the 80th anniversary of the Soviet Union's victory over Nazi Germany in World War Two with a major military parade attended by China's leader

title.children: Putin marks WW2 victory alongside Xi as Ukraine war continues

image.altText: A sheep eating hay looking towards the camera, standing in a dry paddock with other sheep

props.synopsis: Farmers running out of feed and water are being forced to sell livestock in huge numbers as drought conditions roll on in southern Australia.Â

title.children: No feed, no water and no money â€” drought smashes farmers on all fronts

image.altText: Keith stands under a gum tree holding a pair on binoculars

props.synopsis: Native vegetation returns in abundance to Victoria's Barmah National Park in an "amazing" rebound an ecologist says has never been witnessed before.

title.children: Brumby cull makes way for 'magical landscape change' in national park

image.altText: A man stands in front of several black plastic trays piled on top of each other.

props.synopsis: A Coffin Bay oyster farmer and his recycling team have spent weeks shredding waste plastic from producers on the NSW coast in the hopes of boosting the industry's recycling.

title.children: Shredder helps recycle 'half a footy field' of plastic from oyster farms

image.altText: US President Donald Trump speaks to reporters from behind a lectern in the oval office

props.synopsis: Top US officials are set to meet with a high-level Chinese delegation in Switzerland in the first major talks between the two nations since Trump's tariffs were set.

title.children: Trump floats dropping China tariffs to 80 per cent ahead of talks

image.altText: Sycamore Gap tree

props.synopsis: UK men Daniel Graham and Adam Carruthers found guilty of the "mindless" felling of the 200-year-old tree in 2023.

title.children: Two men convicted of cutting down England's iconic Sycamore Gap tree

image.altText: Cricketer Mitchell Starc with teammates wait for an umpire decision.

props.synopsis: The IPL will reportedly be postponed due to the ongoing conflict between India and Pakistan.

title.children: IPL tournament suspended amid India-Pakistan conflict as Australians look to fly home

image.altText: Owen Cooper leans back in a chair and smirks while acting in Adolescence.

props.synopsis: The TV show has adults talking or, shall we say, anxious. But what do young people think about it?

title.children: 'It's like real life': Teens divided over showing Adolescence in schools

image.altText: Sheikh Wesam Charkawi, The Muslim Vote convener

props.synopsis: Labor maintained their key seats in Western Sydney, but it was not without a fight.

title.children: 'No question' Gaza played role in Western Sydney seats swing

image.altText: An unidentified man using a chainsaw to trim a tree branch

props.synopsis: Having trees and shrubs encroaching on your property is a common problem, but it is important to take the right steps to address it.

title.children: Can you cut your neighbour's overhanging trees? Here are the rules

image.altText: An Aboriginal man wearing a black graphic tee, with gray hair, speaking at a podium in front of a Garma festival banner.

props.synopsis: Arnhem Land leader Mr B YunupiÅ‹u will be remembered as a softly spoken man of honour and wisdom, after his death following an alleged attack in his home community.

image.altText: A group of 8 people are standing in front of a table where two agreements are held up. they are standing outside

props.synopsis: A regional town in New South Wales is making history with a "momentous" partnership that embeds Closing the Gap targets into local government processes for the first time.
